guided_meditations.title: Body Scan Meditation
guided_meditations.description: A mindfulness practice to connect with your body and release tension
script: Find a comfortable position lying down or sitting
Close your eyes and take three deep breaths
Bring your attention to the top of your head
Notice any sensations - warmth, coolness, tingling, or tension
Slowly move your attention down through your face
Notice your jaw, cheeks, and forehead
Continue down through your neck and shoulders
Feel the weight of your arms resting by your sides
Move through your chest and abdomen
Notice your breathing without trying to change it
Continue down through your hips and legs
Feel your feet resting on the ground
Take a moment to feel your whole body
When ready, slowly open your eyes

guided_meditations.title: Loving-Kindness Meditation
guided_meditations.description: Cultivate compassion for yourself and others
script: Sit comfortably and close your eyes
Take a few deep breaths to center yourself
Begin by directing loving-kindness toward yourself
Repeat silently: 'May I be happy, may I be healthy, may I be safe, may I live with ease'
Think of someone you love deeply
Direct these same wishes toward them
Think of a neutral person - someone you neither like nor dislike
Send them the same loving wishes
Think of someone you have difficulty with
Try to send them loving-kindness as well
Finally, extend these wishes to all beings everywhere
Take a moment to feel the warmth of compassion
Slowly return your attention to the present moment

guided_meditations.title: Mindful Breathing
guided_meditations.description: Focus on the breath to anchor yourself in the present moment
script: Sit in a comfortable position with your back straight
Close your eyes or soften your gaze
Bring your attention to your breath
Notice the sensation of air entering your nostrils
Feel your chest and belly rise with each inhale
Notice the pause between inhale and exhale
Feel the air leaving your body
Notice the pause before the next breath
When your mind wanders, gently return to the breath
Don't judge your thoughts - just observe them
Continue for the full duration
Slowly open your eyes when ready
